result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sabrina S Alford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sabrina S Alford in court.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Status of Counsel. 
Court advised defendant the State Public Defender Office need additional time to appoint counsel.
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel and Bail Bond hearing.
Case calendared in Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sabrina S Alford not in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Sabrina S Alford.  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Status Conference.  
Defense move to withdraw as counsel of record due to conflict in her office and request a bail motion. Defense counsel has notified office counsel is needed. Court ordered case adjourned for bail motion and status of counsel


Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sabrina S Alford in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski; both appear by video.  Defendant Sabrina S Alford in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge K. Ashley. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with CMH.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, bail to revert to $2,500.00 .  If alternative Cash Bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. Monitoring is for no contact monitoring only.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with breathalyzer tests.
  Court ordered random drug testing.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sabrina S Alford in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Sabrina S Alford in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
